page.title: 05Description of ref. 03680069
page.content: This area is largely uninhabited but does contain features of interest. The Ministry of Defence has a major installation in this area. This installation is known as the Admiralty Research Establishment (A.R.E.) and is involved with submarine technology and torpedo design and research. Over 1500 people are employed at this establishment but many of them live in Weymouth and travel daily to work across the causeway. Also in the area are fields farmed by inmates of the Youth Custody Centre, formerly known as H.M.Borstal. The land they work includes terraces which were part of an ancient field system. The eastern section of the square includes interesting cliffs, caves, wave cut platforms and a blow hole. The platforms are used by anglers, sunbathers and, on occasions, seals.
